    • Method Detail

      • createHierarchicalTempFile

        public static File createHierarchicalTempFile(File baseDirectory,
                              int pathElements,
                              String prefix,
                              String suffix)
                                       throws IOException
        Creates a temporary file with a random hierachical path.

        A random hierarchical path of n path elements is a sequence of n directories of two hexadecimal digits each, followed by a filename created by File.createTempFile(String, String, File).

        This method creates an empty file having a random hierarchical path of the specified number of path elements under a given base directory, creating all needed directories along the hierarchical path (whereas the base directory is expected to already exist).

        Parameters:
        baseDirectory - the base directory (it must exist).
        pathElements - the number of path elements (filename excluded), must be in [0,8]
        prefix - will be passed to File.createTempFile(String, String, File)
        suffix - will be passed to File.createTempFile(String, String, File)
        Returns:
        the temporary file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(String s)
        Returns a byte-array representation of an ASCII string.

        This method is significantly faster than those relying on character encoders, and it allocates just one object—the resulting byte array.

        Parameters:
        s - an ASCII string.
        Returns:
        a byte-array representation of s.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if assertions are enabled and some character of s is not ASCII.

      • toOutputStream

        public static OutputStream toOutputStream(String s,
                          OutputStream os)
                                   throws IOException
        Writes a string to an output stream, discarding higher order bits.

        This method is significantly faster than those relying on character encoders, and it does not allocate any object.

        Parameters:
        s - a string.
        os - an output stream.
        Returns:
        os.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if assertions are enabled and some character of s does not fit a byte.
        IOException

      • toByteArrayList

        public static ByteArrayList toByteArrayList(String s,
                            ByteArrayList list)
        Writes an ASCII string in a ByteArrayList.
        Parameters:
        s - an ASCII string.
        list - a byte list that will contain the byte representation of s.
        Returns:
        list.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if assertions are enabled and some character of s is not ASCII.

      • toString

        public static String toString(ByteArrayList byteArrayList)
        Returns a string representation of an ASCII byte array.

        This method is significantly faster than those relying on character encoders, and it allocates just one object—the resulting string.

        Parameters:
        byteArrayList - an ASCII byte-array list.
        Returns:
        a string representation of byteArrayList.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if assertions are enabled and some character of byteArrayList is not ASCII.
